page.title: 19Biography - Famous Person
page.content: Cyril Smith MBE OStJ, Liberal MP for Rochdale, is the most well-known local figure and has done much to voice the town's needs in the arena of national politics. He became Rochdale's MP in 1952 and has held this position to date. His physical presence is particularly imposing as he weighs approximately 29 stone!; however, he says that he doesn't mind about his weight. His suits are made in Rochdale but his shirts are made in London, by the same man who makes shirts for Prince Charles. When interviewed about his life as a public figure, he told us that he enjoys helping people and loves the busy - busy of political life.
